revised_title: Double Refraction and Absorption Properties of Oxalate of Chromium and Potash
tldr: The author, Sir David Brewster, studied the double refraction and absorption properties of the oxalate of chromium and potash crystals. He discovered that the crystals exhibit different colors when viewed by reflected or transmitted light, and the two images formed by double refraction have different color compositions. The salt also has a specific action on a particular red ray in the spectrum when exposed to polarized light.
